description: Join our dynamic team as a key contributor in the core delivery department, working on exciting client programs focused on demand response and energy efficiency. As part of our passionate and collaborative team, you'll have the opportunity to closely collaborate with both business and technical stakeholders to drive impactful outcomes. Initially, this role will be remote, with a future return to our vibrant office located in Oak Brook, Il when it reopens. Reporting to our dedicated senior leader overseeing this client engagement, you'll play a vital role in shaping our success.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Support and nurture description: <strong>Company Overview</strong><p><br></p>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<p><br></p>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<p><br></p>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<p><br></p><strong>Department Overview</strong><p><br></p>Motorola Solutions is building talent pipelines to meet future hiring demands. This is a pipeline role, while there is not an immediate opening, we want to build relationships with prospective candidates like you. If your background is a match to our requirements, we’ll follow up with an exploratory conversation.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements.</strong><p><br></p>Candidates for this position are electrical, computer, or software engineers with strong programming skills who demonstrate curiosity, continuous learning, and an ability to adapt. Ideal candidates have a background in digital signal processing and Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning along with diverse knowledge and a wide variety of interests, especially in cellular / wireless communications. Hands on experience in embedded software development is also beneficial.<p><br></p>You will be a member of a small (2-6 person) multi-disciplinary team and will be responsible for implementing and testing digital signal processing and AI/ML solutions for a variety of advanced Software Defined Radio (SDR) and other platforms. You must be a flexible, results-oriented problem-solver who requires minimal supervision and can multitask. Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges. You will have the opportunity to create proof-of-concept and low-volume specialty communications products for government and private industry.<p><br></p>Daily Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for design, implementation, and testing of complex embedded software applications for state-of-the-art small form factor SDR platforms</li><li>Participate in cutting edge artificial intelligence (AI) research and product development, focused on embedded, edge device wireless communication systems. </li><li>Develop solutions for real world systems, leveraging AI/ML algorithms for standalone products and to enhance existing Applied Technology offerings. </li><li>Regular interaction with customers for requirements capture, design support, and demonstrations</li><li>Meaningfully communicate with members of all engineering disciplines (hardware, RF, software, FPGA, etc) as well as management</li><li>Collaborate with multi-disciplinary product development teams to identify performance improvement opportunities and integrate trained models. </li><li>Hands-on interaction with product hardware for developing and debugging. </li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Less than 5 years of experience in software development or AI/ML research and development</li><li>Experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow and Pytorch) and knowledge of neural network fundamentals. </li><li>Experience with GPU programming with CUDA, OpenCL and/or GPU-based software acceleration libraries</li><li>Understanding of real-time embedded software design and experience programming in Linux, C, C++, Python and other software languages and operating systems</li><li>Working knowledge of basic wireless communication theory</li><li>Experience with the implementation of digital signal processing blocks</li><li>Experience with digital signal processing system design and analysis using MATLAB</li><li>Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges. </li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>Agile software development and/or Git/JIRA experience is a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements. </li><li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field</li></ul><p><br></p>Travel Requirements<p><br></p>None<p><br></p>Relocation Provided<p><br></p>None<p><br></p>Position Type<p><br></p>Experienced<p><br></p>Referral Payment Plan<p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>EEO Statement</strong></em><p><br></p>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.<p><br></p>

Included in this position is the support of intelligent embedded software devices including microprocessor-based switch and fault interrupting controls. Candidates must have a strong background in design and development of embedded software on custom electronics.<p><br></p>This position can be remote (located in the United States) or on-site/hybrid at one of our office locations (Chicago, Alameda, or Franklin). Occasional travel to (10%) to one of these locations may be required for development, system integration/testing, and debugging. In this position, you will report to the Senior Manager – Embedded Firmware in Chicago.<p><br></p><strong>The work associated with this position includes, but is not limited to, the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design embedded application firmware for microprocessor-based fault interrupting controls.</li><li>Contribute to the development of architecture design, software specifications, project schedules, task and project completion time estimates, and test plans.</li><li>Develop embedded C/C++ firmware for low power designs, including hardware device drivers.</li><li>Develop and support PC-based engineering test tools as needed.</li><li>Create, execute, and automate Unit Tests.</li><li>Review and implement product requirements.</li><li>Participate in Agile scrum meetings and peer reviews of source code.</li><li>Investigate new technologies and create design documents as necessary.</li><li>Collaborate with hardware and test engineers to support verification and validation of products at the module level and system level.</li><li>Work with product management and field services to resolve firmware-related customer issues. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Being a team player is essential.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Technical leadership abilities with good interpersonal skills.</li><li>Continuous learner and self-starter.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of programming principles in C/C++ and Python.</li><li>Familiarity with real-time operation and low power microprocessor modes.</li><li>Embedded software development experience with and without an operating system.</li><li>Experience with digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers.</li><li>Experience working with and writing drivers for common peripherals and interconnects, such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, DAC, UART, DMA, flash memory.</li><li>Experience with configuration management/process tools: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket/Git.</li><li>Experience in one or more of the following areas is preferred: electric grid automation and/or control for utility applications, peer-to-peer communications techniques, wired and wireless communications experience (Ethernet, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi). </li><li>Experience with signal processing (FFT, DFT, waveform analysis) and actuator/motor control is a plus.</li><li>Experience with Jenkins and Docker is a plus.</li><li>Experience with embedded Linux, Zephyr, or other real time operating systems is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Relevant Experience Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5-7 years of experience developing C/C++ firmware applications and device drivers for low power designs. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>MAJOR PHYSICAL DEMANDS</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Standing: Occasional standing for work on complete control assemblies.</li><li>Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds.</li><li>Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility.</li><li>Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects.</li><li>Pushing: Infrequent
